Hey guys and girls, I'm new here and I'm trying to solve a problem with using modules in dynamic pages. I explain in details on this forum post. I will apreciatte if anybody could take a time to help me. :pray:

<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/How-to-use-modules-in-Dynamic-Pages-and-make-possible-user-edit/m-p/332186>
Short answer is no I believe. Dynamic pages are setup and are in their own island
It seems like the UI for hubdb isn't working well for your marketing people to be able to add/edit content for your pages
This is a real pain for lots of people
SO, the work around to this is creating an integration that feeds data into your HubDB from a better UI that is more like what HubSpot offers.

So the solution to this is to build an app that reads your hubdb table, and displays it more like a CMS, to allow for easier input. Then you allow for a row to be clicked on, then you are able to preview/edit those fields. I think for all rich text stuff you use something like tinyMCE editor (<https://www.tiny.cloud/>)
then upon saving that "product" or row.. you then update the HubDB table.
This could also be achieved by making a chrome extension plugin that alters and modifies the CSS and display of the HubDB content and improves upon the UI
